newsitem.title: USA: NYCE cotton called to open 0.10 cent firmer.
newsitem.headline: NYCE cotton called to open 0.10 cent firmer.

text.p: NYCE cotton futures were called to open 0.10 cent firmer Thursday, based on market orders at 1018 EDT, dealers said.
USDA put new sales in the 1996/97 crop at 104,800 bales for the week ended May 1.
Traders called the report mildly bullish, but added that players are likely to remain cautious ahead of the USDA report released Monday at 0830 EDT.
The report will include the final estimates for the old crop and the first estimates for the new crop.

Wednesday, most-active July ended 0.10 cent lower at 71.92 cents a lb, having ranged from 72.10 to 71.65 cents. December finished down 0.17 cent at 74.46 cents, while the rest of the board finished unchanged to 0.26 cent lower.
Technical support in July was seen at the contract low of 71.00 cents hit Tuesday, and then at 70.00 cents.
A total of 753 notices have been issued to date, NYCE said.
